definition: to diminish/to demote/to reduce or devaluate/to disparage/to censure/to depreciate
to decrease/to lose/to damage/to harm/(coll.) to speak sarcastically/to deride/caustic/mean/one of the 64 hexagrams of the Book of Changes (䷨)

sentences.english: The editor expunged all potentially offensive and derogatory material from the book.
sentences.chinese: 编辑删除了书中可能冒犯和贬损他人的内容。

sentences.english: They express great dissatisfaction. Now some of them refer to Chinese people in a derogatory manner.
sentences.chinese: 他们都很不满，提到汉人，有些人用了贬损的态度。

sentences.english: So, the same denigration tends to be more general.
sentences.chinese: 所以这种贬损的心理是非常普遍的。

sentences.english: I think that Schuman and Summer feel too much heat from China, and cling to a lesser opponent for the relief.
sentences.chinese: 我想舒曼是得中国焦虑症，因而贬损对方以求安慰。

sentences.english: One who disparages or belittles the worth of something.
sentences.chinese: 贬损或蔑视某物的价值的人。

sentences.english: It could provoke a public tit-for-tat between the two parties that ultimately demeans the coalition.
sentences.chinese: 它可以掀起两党之间的公开斗争从而贬损联合政府。

sentences.english: Statutes are not to be presumed to derogate from international law.
sentences.chinese: 不能认为制定法贬损国际法。

definition: to belittle/to disparage/to play down/to demean/to degrade/to devalue
to defame/to libel/to defile/to smear/to vilify
to speak sarcastically/to make cutting remarks
to criticize/to find fault with/to denounce
